required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of Augmenting Exercise Intensity vs. Frequency
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Augmenting Exercise Intensity vs. Frequency on Peak Work Rate

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare the impact of augmenting exercise intensity and augmenting exercise frequency on peak work rate. Participants will complete exercise tests and provide 8 skeletal muscle samples following a within-subjects randomized crossover design utilizing single-leg cycling. Both training periods will be 4 weeks long and skeletal muscle biopsies will be collected from both legs before and after each training period. All exercise sessions will be supervised, take place in the investigator's laboratory, and occur on stationary bikes.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Before exercise training on two days (~7 and 6 days before first training session; ~24 hours apart), and after exercise on two days (~48-96 hours after the last training session; ~24 hours apart)
primary_outcome.description: Change in Highest work rate achieved (30s period) during incremental exercise tests

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before exercise training on two days (~7 and 6 days before first training session; ~24 hours apart), and after exercise on two days (~48-96 hours after the last training session; ~24 hours apart)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in Highest oxygen uptake achieved (30s period) during incremental exercise tests

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before exercise training (~7 days before first training session), and after exercise training (~48-72 hours after the last training session)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in maximal citrate synthase activity

arm_group.description: Training period 1: Frequency comparison Training period 2: Intensity comparison
Training period 1: Intensity comparison Training period 2: Frequency comparison

intervention.description: One leg assigned to low-frequency low-intensity (3 days per week of 11 x 1 min @ 73% peak work rate interspersed with 1-minute periods of active recovery). The other leg assigned to high-frequency low-intensity (5 days per week of 11 x 1 min @ 73% peak work rate interspersed with 1-minute periods of active recovery).

One leg assigned to low-frequency low-intensity (3 days per week of 11 x 1 min @ 73% peak work rate interspersed with 1-minute periods of active recovery). The other leg assigned to low-frequency high-intensity (3 days per week of 8 x 1 min @ 100% peak work rate interspersed with 1-minute periods of active recovery).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Recreational active (<3 hours per week of aerobic exercise)
- Willing to provide skeletal muscle biopsies
Exclusion Criteria:
- Cardiovascular or metabolic disease
- Athletes or individuals exceeding 3 hours per week of aerobic exercise
- Smokers

facility.name: Queen's Muscle Physiology Lab in the School of Kinesiology and Health Studies at Queen's University

responsible_party.investigator_title: Professor, School of Kinesiology & Health Studies, Queen's University
